questions.text: What is the minimum age requirement for Supportive Housing services?
questions.explanation: According to page 9, eligible populations for Supportive Housing services include individuals who are 16 or older.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a health needs-based criteria for CSS eligibility?

options.B: Need for outpatient substance use disorder treatment
options.C: Need for assistance with three or more ADLs

questions.explanation: Employment support is not listed as a health needs-based criteria for CSS. The criteria listed on page 9 include mental health need, substance use disorder treatment, and ADL assistance.

questions.text: What is the billing code for Supportive Housing services per diem?
questions.explanation: Page 9 states that when billing for Supportive Housing services, use code H0043 for per diem services.

questions.text: What is the daily rate for Community Support Services (H0043)?
questions.explanation: According to the FCS Rate Increase Table on page 44, the permanent rate for H0043 effective July 1, 2020 is $112 per diem.

questions.text: What is the benefit limitation for CSS services over a 180-day period?
questions.explanation: Page 11 states that CSS encounters have a benefit limitation of 30 days over a 180-day authorization period.

questions.text: What is the minimum age requirement for Individual Placement and Support (IPS) services?
questions.explanation: Page 14 states that the individual must be at least 16 years of age to meet IPS eligibility criteria.

questions.text: What is the billing code for Pre-employment services?
questions.explanation: Page 15 identifies H2023 as the code for Pre-employment services - activities that assist an individual with obtaining employment.

questions.text: What is the rate per 15-minute unit for supported employment services (H2023 and H2025)?
questions.explanation: The FCS Rate Increase Table on page 44 shows the permanent rate effective July 1, 2020 for both H2023 and H2025 is $27 per 15-minute unit.

questions.text: What is the maximum number of units allowed for supported employment services over a 180-day period?
questions.explanation: Page 16 states that pre-employment and employment-sustaining services are limited to 120 units over a 180-day period.

questions.text: What documentation format is commonly used for progress notes?
questions.explanation: Page 63 states that the DARP (Description, Assessment, Response, Plan) format is commonly used and contains all elements required for effective documentation.

questions.text: How many years of experience in coordination of Supportive Housing services are required for provider qualification?
questions.explanation: Page 28 states that providers need two years' experience in the coordination of Supportive Housing or in the coordination of independent living services in a social service setting under qualified supervision.

questions.text: What is the minimum duration for a billable telephone call?
questions.explanation: Pages 12 and 14 both state that telephone calls of at least 15 minutes are billable.

questions.text: What is the timely filing deadline for claims submission?
questions.explanation: Page 20 states that timely filing is within 365 calendar days of the date of service.

questions.text: Can CSS services be provided or billed before authorization?
questions.explanation: Page 12 clearly states that CSS may not be provided or billed prior to an authorization for service.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT excluded from CSS benefits?
questions.explanation: Page 11-12 lists CSS exclusions which include rent, capital costs, utilities, but care coordination is part of the service.

questions.text: By what day of the month must providers submit their monthly outcome and capacity reports?
questions.explanation: Page 32 states that Provider Outcome and Capacity Reports are due before the 10th of every month.

questions.text: What qualifies as 'frequent' institutional contacts for CSS eligibility?

options.A: One or more contacts in 12 months
options.B: Two or more contacts in 12 months
options.C: Three or more contacts in 12 months
options.D: Four or more contacts in 12 months

questions.explanation: Page 9 defines frequent as two or more contacts in the past 12 months.

questions.text: Which certification is acceptable for staff performing Supported Employment Services?
questions.explanation: Page 29 lists CESP certification by the Employment Support Professional Certification Council as one of the acceptable qualifications.

questions.text: How often are enrollees entitled to a free copy of their treatment record?
questions.explanation: Page 62 states that enrollees are entitled to one copy of their treatment record each year at no cost.

questions.text: Within how many calendar days must clean claims be adjudicated?
questions.explanation: Page 52 states that Wellpoint will adjudicate clean claims to a paid or denied status within 30 calendar days of receipt.

questions.text: According to IPS principles, how quickly should job search begin?
questions.explanation: Page 13 states that beginning the job search process early (within 30 days) demonstrates to enrollees their desire to work is taken seriously.

questions.text: What form must accompany an Exception to Rule (ETR) request?
questions.explanation: Page 23 states that providers must submit a signed Single Case Agreement Form with ETR requests.

questions.text: What does H2025 code represent?
questions.explanation: Page 16 identifies H2025 as Employment-sustaining services - activities that support the individual in retaining and maintaining employment.

questions.text: How long is each authorization period for FCS services?
questions.explanation: Multiple references throughout the manual indicate authorization periods are 180 days.

questions.text: When must critical incidents be reported to Wellpoint?
questions.explanation: Page 6 states that critical incidents must be reported to Wellpoint on the same business day of occurrence or provider awareness.

questions.text: How old can an assessment be when submitted to Wellpoint?
questions.explanation: Page 22 states that the assessment may not be more than 10 business days old when submitted.

questions.text: What is the maximum routine in-office wait time for scheduled appointments?
questions.explanation: Page 28 states that in-office wait time for scheduled appointments should not routinely exceed 45 minutes.

questions.text: Which is NOT an eligible Apple Health coverage group for FCS?
questions.explanation: Page 21 lists eligible coverage groups, which do not include Emergency Medicaid.

questions.text: What is the Availity Payer ID for FCS claims?
questions.explanation: Page 6 and page 51 both indicate the Availity Payer ID is WLPNT.

questions.text: Which type of employment setting is excluded from FCS supported employment services?
questions.explanation: Page 14 explicitly excludes employment support for individuals in subminimum or sheltered workshop settings.

questions.text: How many attempts must be made to contact an inactive enrollee before involuntary disenrollment?
questions.explanation: Page 24 states that at least four attempts at contacting the inactive FCS enrollee must occur over a minimum of six weeks.

questions.text: Which element must be included on each page of treatment records?
questions.explanation: Page 62 states that treatment records must include enrollee identification information shown on each page or electronic file.

questions.text: During an enrollment pause, what is the window for reauthorizing individuals after authorization expires?
questions.explanation: Page 26 states that during an enrollment pause, the FCS program will have a 30-day window for reauthorizing individuals after their authorization has expired.

questions.text: Within how many days must providers return self-identified overpayments?
questions.explanation: Page 54 states providers must return overpayments within sixty (60) calendar days after the date on which the overpayment was identified.

questions.text: What is the SIU fraud referral hotline number?
questions.explanation: Page 35 provides the SIU fraud referral hotline as 866-847-8247.

questions.text: What is the maximum TAP funding amount per 12-month period for move-in assistance?
questions.explanation: Page 67 states that move-in assistance can be up to $5,000 total per 12-month period.

questions.text: What type of NPI is required for FCS provider contracting?
questions.explanation: Page 6 specifies that providers need an NPI number (type 2 organization NPI) for contracting.

questions.text: What does the 'M' in SMART goals stand for?
questions.explanation: Page 63 explains that SMART goals are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-Bound.

questions.text: How many days do providers have to submit a claim payment appeal after the reconsideration determination?
questions.explanation: Page 59 states that claim payment appeals must be submitted within 30 calendar days of the date on the reconsideration determination letter.

questions.text: According to Supportive Housing principles, can tenants be evicted for rejecting services?
questions.explanation: Page 10 clearly states that tenants cannot be evicted from their housing for rejecting services, disenrolling from FCS services or for changing FCS service provider.
